examples.full_description: User has a password confirmation field

examples.description: is valid if password and password_confirmation match
examples.full_description: User is valid if password and password_confirmation match

examples.description: is valid if password is set and password_confirmation is nil
examples.full_description: User is valid if password is set and password_confirmation is nil

examples.description: is invalid if password and password_confirmation are both non-nil and don't match
examples.full_description: User is invalid if password and password_confirmation are both non-nil and don't match

examples.description: returns the user if credentials match
examples.full_description: User authenticate returns the user if credentials match

examples.description: returns false if credentials don't match
examples.full_description: User authenticate returns false if credentials don't match
Users POST /signup with matching password confirmation creates a new user

examples.description: saves the password as password_digest to allow authentication
examples.full_description: Users POST /signup with matching password confirmation saves the password as password_digest to allow authentication

examples.description: saves the user id in the session
examples.full_description: Users POST /signup with matching password confirmation saves the user id in the session
Users POST /signup with matching password confirmation returns the user as JSON
Users POST /signup with no matching password confirmation does not save the user
Users POST /signup with no matching password confirmation returns a 422 unprocessable entity response

examples.description: returns the first user when the first user is logged in
examples.full_description: Users GET /me returns the first user when the first user is logged in

examples.description: returns the second user when the second user is logged in
examples.full_description: Users GET /me returns the second user when the second user is logged in

examples.description: returns a 401 unauthorized response when no user is logged in
examples.full_description: Users GET /me returns a 401 unauthorized response when no user is logged in
